Plot:
To save her father from death in the army, a young maiden secretly
goes in his place and becomes one of China's greatest heroines in
the process.

Directors: Tony Bancroft, Barry Cook

Writers: Robert D. San Souci (based on a story by), Rita Hsiao
(screenplay)

Stars: Ming-Na Wen, Eddie Murphy, BD Wong

Storyline

This retelling of the old Chinese folktale is about the story of a
young Chinese maiden who learns that her weakened and lame father is
to be called up into the army in order to fight the invading Huns.
Knowing that he would never survive the rigours of war in his state,
she decides to disguise herself and join in his place. Unknown to
her, her ancestors are aware of this and to prevent it, they order a
tiny disgraced dragon, Mushu to join her in order to force her to
abandon her plan. He agrees, but when he meets Mulan, he learns that
she cannot be dissuaded and so decides to help her in the perilous
times ahead.
